title: Pistachio Green Is the Tasty New Trend Taking Over Bedrooms This Year
description: Here’s how to style the calming color designers are craving
author: Jacorey Moon
excerpt: Pistachio green is the calming, trendy color designers are craving to style a bedroom. Here, find decorating tips and our editor-approved bedding to shop now
text: All products featured on Architectural Digest are independently selected by our editors. However, we may receive compensation from retailers and/or from purchases of products through these links.Featured in this articleBed Threads Pistachio Bedding SetRead moreBrooklinen Fern Airweave Cotton QuiltRead moreSerena & Lily Pistachio Border Sateen Duvet CoverRead moreIf you’ve noticed a soft, soothing green popping up everywhere from paint decks to pillow shams this season, you’re not alone: pistachio green has quietly become the design world’s new favorite not-quite-neutral. Like the butter yellow trend that's taken the internet by storm, this one plays on foodification too. Pistachio green is reminiscent of the salty snack tucked away in your pantry, and several AD PRO Directory designers say its warm hue is a welcome treat for your bedding.“It’s that perfect balance of soft and fresh—a happy color that plays well with nearly everything,” says Laura Jenkins, the owner of Laura W. Jenkins Interiors. Calling it “a cozy hug for any room,” Noz Nozawa, principal designer of Noz Design, adds that it makes whatever’s around it feel more inviting.This colorway is having a moment for all the right reasons. Post-pandemic, homeowners crave colors that bring the calm of the outdoors in, but pistachio green does so without the commitment of darker or more saturated shades. According to these pros, it’s the ideal way to dip a toe into color while still keeping your bedroom restful and bright—and it’s more versatile than you might think.Below, the designers go in-depth about how to style this flexible shade of green. Plus, we're sharing editor-approved bedding to shop the look. Whether you’re looking to incorporate it in a grandiose, flashy way or a small, minute approach, pistachio green can help you make a statement.Our Top Picks1/15Bed Threads Pistachio Bedding SetA cult favorite for good reason, Bed Threads’ bed linen set is breathable, timeless, and softens wonderfully over time. In addition to the classic pistachio green hue, senior digital design editor Zoë Sessums says this relaxed linen set has a buttery texture that makes it a mainstay in her bedding rotation. “I found these to be sturdy, beautiful, and perfect for temperature control,” she says in her review.2/15Brooklinen Fern Airweave Cotton QuiltThis lightweight quilt delivers texture and subtle color in a single, easy-to-use layer. Not only is this Brooklinen quilt lightweight and fluffy, but it is also versatile for styling. You can lay this quilt on top of your freshly dressed bed for the perfect pop of color or cuddle up on the couch during a cold day in cozy splendor. Contributor Yelena Moroz Alpert has the brand’s Airweave cotton quilt and says it’s “incredibly soft and light, but at the same time, feels substantial,” adding that she loves “how the slightly tufted texture makes it look like a cloud.”3/15Serena & Lily Pistachio Border Sateen Duvet CoverSateen is known for being smooth and lustrous, though distinguished in handling. Made with 100% cotton sateen, opting for this cover will add a polished finish to your bedspread. It is the perfect amount of landscape to play with, as you can easily mix patterns or prints with the bold pistachio border. Additionally, it isn’t overly thick, making this option ideal for overheaters or those residing in warmer climates. “I would definitely recommend this duvet cover from Serena & Lily if it’s in your price range,” says contributor Rebecca Grambone. “The material is top-notch, its design is simple and versatile, and most importantly, it’s comfortable. You won’t be sacrificing sleepover style.”4/15Quince Sage European Linen Duvet Cover SetFor those who love a lived-in, super soft duvet cover, you’ll love this one from Quince. Furthermore, this set offers excellent value by including the duvet cover and shams for seamless coordination. Commerce writer Julia Harrison notes that this cover set is sensible, durable, and highly comfortable. “It staves off wrinkles fairly well [and] keeps me warm but not sweaty,” says Harrison. “I think it’s an efficient linen option, if not the most luxe on the market.”5/15Linoto Mint Linen Sheet SetHandmade from top-notch Belgian and Italian linen (and machine washable), Linoto offers the perfect casual linen sheet that complements nearly any aesthetic. It’s also incredibly comfortable to sleep on, according to contributor Erika Owen who adores how breezy these sheets feel. “I also love the lived-in look they constantly have, thanks to the easy wrinkling,” she adds.6/15BrooklinenMoss Stripe Classic Percale Duvet SetWho doesn’t love the crisp, starchy feel of percale? This duvet set from Brooklinen doesn’t stray from that reputation. Composed of 100% long-staple cotton, Brooklinen’s classic percale duvet set has a cool and breathable consistency that works year-round. “I love how crisp and smooth the percale is—in both appearance and touch,” says AD PRO senior editor Mel Studach. “And inserting the duvet was simple with help from the cover’s ‘long’ and ‘short’ interior tags.” Added bonus: Its green stripes can elevate a space in coastal fashion.More Bedding We’re Browsing7/15Article Willow Green Uden BedIf you’re looking for a showstopper that’s sure to ground the bedroom, this Article Uden king bed will suit your fancy. Its gently curved silhouette makes it easy to pair with bold patterns or sharp lines alike, while the softly textured upholstery doubles as a comfy backrest for reading or lounging.8/15Matouk Astor Braid Duvet CoverMatouk’s Astor braid duvet cover exudes sophistication thanks to its 520-thread-count Ceylon cotton percale, which makes for a breathable yet structured slumber. What’s more, the braiding design creates an easy focal point for the eye to travel, which can add a layer of good storytelling to your space.9/15Article Pacific Sage Noel Velvet HeadboardVelvet screams opulence, and with the help of this headboard from Article, you can execute this emotion on-trend. The luscious, three-column design on this option adds a geometric, clean-line appearance to any aesthetic, and the shade of sage green is complementary to a slew of colors—even a brighter shade of pistachio.10/15Piglet in Bed Pine Green Stripe Linen Fitted SheetStripes are a versatile pattern that is easy to juxtapose and balance with colors—something about their alternating color scheme always conveys elevated energy. This bed sheets set from Piglet in Bed features a color combination of dark green and light green, which adds moodiness to a room while also feeling refined and preppy. Also, it reads as a nice way to break up monotony within a space.11/15Buffy Lichen Breeze Duvet CoverDid you know you could also get a plant-based night’s sleep? Well, with Buffy, you can. The brand’s Breeze duvet cover features an extra-soft, 300 single-ply thread count sateen weave fabric made from Tencel eucalyptus lyocell fibers, which helps absorb moisture and promote a restful sleep. In addition, it’s cool and breezy, which can help you fall and stay asleep when you finally unwind.12/15The Citizenry Sage Stonewashed Linen Duvet CoverWoven in the oldest family-run linen mill in Portugal, this linen duvet cover is crafted from washed cotton linen to create an airy, warm, and plush duvet cover with plenty of coziness. The slightly muted hue offers a nice, understated look for a minimalist bedroom.13/15HYMOKEGE Light Green Comforter Set (Set of 7)For seersucker lovers, you'll love this Amazon comforter set that shoppers say is made with supple microfiber and an anti-wrinkle textured fabric. The deep pocket fitted sheet is designed to keep it from riding up during bouts of tossing and turning—another problem solved.14/15The Company Store Gingham Moss Duvet Cover SetGingham instantly radiates notes of cottagecore and other related settings. This one from The Company Store does it on an organic, cool cotton percale duvet cover set that helps a space evoke classic farmhouse vibes.15/15Sferra Willow Rombo CoverletWhen it comes to shopping for brands with minimalist and high-end bedding, Sferra is a good choice. Incorporating a pre-shrunk, all-cotton material, the Rombo coverlet is a sleek, simplistic take that will tie the room together without adding distractions.How to Style Pistachio GreenUse it like a neutral—but go bigPistachio green is quietly transformative: it’s colorful but gentle, making it an ideal alternative to beiges and greys that can feel flat. Jenkins and Nozawa say its charm lies in its adaptability—it reads warm and organic, which keeps a space feeling alive without being overpowering. That’s why they encourage embracing it beyond a single accent wall. Cover all four walls, carry it through to the trim, or echo it in upholstered furniture or painted light fixtures for a look that feels cohesive and intentional. Paint is easily changed down the line, so committing to pistachio isn’t as risky as a costly built-in. For renters or those who are color-shy, starting with small furnishings in this hue—such as a headboard or a pair of lamps—can deliver the same soothing energy without a total room makeover.Layer it into your bedscapeOne of the easiest ways to invite pistachio green into a bedroom is through bedding. Soft linen coverlets, cotton quilts, or an airy duvet in this gentle green can instantly update a neutral bed while still feeling calm and sleep-friendly. For a subtle approach, layer a pistachio throw or patterned blanket across the foot of the bed to break up a white duvet or crisp sheet set. If you’re more confident, a matching sheet set or quilted coverlet in pistachio can create a polished, resort-like feel at home. Designers recommend balancing color with plenty of texture—think washed linen, lightweight matelassé, or seersucker—so the bedscape feels rich and inviting rather than flat.Try a monochrome momentFor the design-savvy, pistachio green shines in a tone-on-tone, monochrome look. It’s a way to experiment with color blocking while maintaining a serene vibe. The key is to mix shades and textures. Hence, the space has depth: pair walls painted in a soft pistachio with slightly darker trim, add bedding in a complementary green pattern or subtle stripe, and choose natural accents like woven shades, oak furniture, or boucle pillows to keep it tactile. Monochrome doesn’t have to mean identical swatches—slight shifts in tone and an interplay of patterns, like gingham or small-scale florals, can create dimension and prevent the room from feeling one-note.
html:
All products featured on Architectural Digest are independently selected by our editors. However, we may receive compensation from retailers and/or from purchases of products through these links.

Featured in this article

If you’ve noticed a soft, soothing green popping up everywhere from paint decks to pillow shams this season, you’re not alone: pistachio green has quietly become the design world’s new favorite not-quite-neutral. Like the butter yellow trend that's taken the internet by storm, this one plays on foodification too. Pistachio green is reminiscent of the salty snack tucked away in your pantry, and several AD PRO Directory designers say its warm hue is a welcome treat for your bedding.

“It’s that perfect balance of soft and fresh—a happy color that plays well with nearly everything,” says Laura Jenkins, the owner of Laura W. Jenkins Interiors. Calling it “a cozy hug for any room,” Noz Nozawa, principal designer of Noz Design, adds that it makes whatever’s around it feel more inviting.

This colorway is having a moment for all the right reasons. Post-pandemic, homeowners crave colors that bring the calm of the outdoors in, but pistachio green does so without the commitment of darker or more saturated shades. According to these pros, it’s the ideal way to dip a toe into color while still keeping your bedroom restful and bright—and it’s more versatile than you might think.

Below, the designers go in-depth about how to style this flexible shade of green. Plus, we're sharing editor-approved bedding to shop the look. Whether you’re looking to incorporate it in a grandiose, flashy way or a small, minute approach, pistachio green can help you make a statement.

Our Top Picks

  • 1/15

    Bed Threads Pistachio Bedding Set

    A cult favorite for good reason, Bed Threads’ bed linen set is breathable, timeless, and softens wonderfully over time. In addition to the classic pistachio green hue, senior digital design editor Zoë Sessums says this relaxed linen set has a buttery texture that makes it a mainstay in her bedding rotation. “I found these to be sturdy, beautiful, and perfect for temperature control,” she says in her review.

  • 2/15

    Brooklinen Fern Airweave Cotton Quilt

    This lightweight quilt delivers texture and subtle color in a single, easy-to-use layer. Not only is this Brooklinen quilt lightweight and fluffy, but it is also versatile for styling. You can lay this quilt on top of your freshly dressed bed for the perfect pop of color or cuddle up on the couch during a cold day in cozy splendor. Contributor Yelena Moroz Alpert has the brand’s Airweave cotton quilt and says it’s “incredibly soft and light, but at the same time, feels substantial,” adding that she loves “how the slightly tufted texture makes it look like a cloud.”

  • 3/15

    Serena & Lily Pistachio Border Sateen Duvet Cover

    Sateen is known for being smooth and lustrous, though distinguished in handling. Made with 100% cotton sateen, opting for this cover will add a polished finish to your bedspread. It is the perfect amount of landscape to play with, as you can easily mix patterns or prints with the bold pistachio border. Additionally, it isn’t overly thick, making this option ideal for overheaters or those residing in warmer climates. “I would definitely recommend this duvet cover from Serena & Lily if it’s in your price range,” says contributor Rebecca Grambone. “The material is top-notch, its design is simple and versatile, and most importantly, it’s comfortable. You won’t be sacrificing sleepover style.”

  • 4/15

    Quince Sage European Linen Duvet Cover Set

    For those who love a lived-in, super soft duvet cover, you’ll love this one from Quince. Furthermore, this set offers excellent value by including the duvet cover and shams for seamless coordination. Commerce writer Julia Harrison notes that this cover set is sensible, durable, and highly comfortable. “It staves off wrinkles fairly well [and] keeps me warm but not sweaty,” says Harrison. “I think it’s an efficient linen option, if not the most luxe on the market.”

  • 5/15

    Linoto Mint Linen Sheet Set

    Handmade from top-notch Belgian and Italian linen (and machine washable), Linoto offers the perfect casual linen sheet that complements nearly any aesthetic. It’s also incredibly comfortable to sleep on, according to contributor Erika Owen who adores how breezy these sheets feel. “I also love the lived-in look they constantly have, thanks to the easy wrinkling,” she adds.

  • 6/15

    BrooklinenMoss Stripe Classic Percale Duvet Set

    Who doesn’t love the crisp, starchy feel of percale? This duvet set from Brooklinen doesn’t stray from that reputation. Composed of 100% long-staple cotton, Brooklinen’s classic percale duvet set has a cool and breathable consistency that works year-round. “I love how crisp and smooth the percale is—in both appearance and touch,” says AD PRO senior editor Mel Studach. “And inserting the duvet was simple with help from the cover’s ‘long’ and ‘short’ interior tags.” Added bonus: Its green stripes can elevate a space in coastal fashion.

  • More Bedding We’re Browsing

    7/15

    Article Willow Green Uden Bed

    If you’re looking for a showstopper that’s sure to ground the bedroom, this Article Uden king bed will suit your fancy. Its gently curved silhouette makes it easy to pair with bold patterns or sharp lines alike, while the softly textured upholstery doubles as a comfy backrest for reading or lounging.

  • 8/15

    Matouk Astor Braid Duvet Cover

    Matouk’s Astor braid duvet cover exudes sophistication thanks to its 520-thread-count Ceylon cotton percale, which makes for a breathable yet structured slumber. What’s more, the braiding design creates an easy focal point for the eye to travel, which can add a layer of good storytelling to your space.

  • 9/15

    Article Pacific Sage Noel Velvet Headboard

    Velvet screams opulence, and with the help of this headboard from Article, you can execute this emotion on-trend. The luscious, three-column design on this option adds a geometric, clean-line appearance to any aesthetic, and the shade of sage green is complementary to a slew of colors—even a brighter shade of pistachio.

  • 10/15

    Piglet in Bed Pine Green Stripe Linen Fitted Sheet

    Stripes are a versatile pattern that is easy to juxtapose and balance with colors—something about their alternating color scheme always conveys elevated energy. This bed sheets set from Piglet in Bed features a color combination of dark green and light green, which adds moodiness to a room while also feeling refined and preppy. Also, it reads as a nice way to break up monotony within a space.

  • 11/15

    Buffy Lichen Breeze Duvet Cover

    Did you know you could also get a plant-based night’s sleep? Well, with Buffy, you can. The brand’s Breeze duvet cover features an extra-soft, 300 single-ply thread count sateen weave fabric made from Tencel eucalyptus lyocell fibers, which helps absorb moisture and promote a restful sleep. In addition, it’s cool and breezy, which can help you fall and stay asleep when you finally unwind.

  • 12/15

    The Citizenry Sage Stonewashed Linen Duvet Cover

    Woven in the oldest family-run linen mill in Portugal, this linen duvet cover is crafted from washed cotton linen to create an airy, warm, and plush duvet cover with plenty of coziness. The slightly muted hue offers a nice, understated look for a minimalist bedroom.

  • 13/15

    HYMOKEGE Light Green Comforter Set (Set of 7)

    For seersucker lovers, you'll love this Amazon comforter set that shoppers say is made with supple microfiber and an anti-wrinkle textured fabric. The deep pocket fitted sheet is designed to keep it from riding up during bouts of tossing and turning—another problem solved.

  • 14/15

    The Company Store Gingham Moss Duvet Cover Set

    Gingham instantly radiates notes of cottagecore and other related settings. This one from The Company Store does it on an organic, cool cotton percale duvet cover set that helps a space evoke classic farmhouse vibes.

  • 15/15

    Sferra Willow Rombo Coverlet

    When it comes to shopping for brands with minimalist and high-end bedding, Sferra is a good choice. Incorporating a pre-shrunk, all-cotton material, the Rombo coverlet is a sleek, simplistic take that will tie the room together without adding distractions.

How to Style Pistachio Green

Use it like a neutral—but go big

Pistachio green is quietly transformative: it’s colorful but gentle, making it an ideal alternative to beiges and greys that can feel flat. Jenkins and Nozawa say its charm lies in its adaptability—it reads warm and organic, which keeps a space feeling alive without being overpowering. That’s why they encourage embracing it beyond a single accent wall. Cover all four walls, carry it through to the trim, or echo it in upholstered furniture or painted light fixtures for a look that feels cohesive and intentional. Paint is easily changed down the line, so committing to pistachio isn’t as risky as a costly built-in. For renters or those who are color-shy, starting with small furnishings in this hue—such as a headboard or a pair of lamps—can deliver the same soothing energy without a total room makeover.

Layer it into your bedscape

One of the easiest ways to invite pistachio green into a bedroom is through bedding. Soft linen coverlets, cotton quilts, or an airy duvet in this gentle green can instantly update a neutral bed while still feeling calm and sleep-friendly. For a subtle approach, layer a pistachio throw or patterned blanket across the foot of the bed to break up a white duvet or crisp sheet set. If you’re more confident, a matching sheet set or quilted coverlet in pistachio can create a polished, resort-like feel at home. Designers recommend balancing color with plenty of texture—think washed linen, lightweight matelassé, or seersucker—so the bedscape feels rich and inviting rather than flat.

Try a monochrome moment

For the design-savvy, pistachio green shines in a tone-on-tone, monochrome look. It’s a way to experiment with color blocking while maintaining a serene vibe. The key is to mix shades and textures. Hence, the space has depth: pair walls painted in a soft pistachio with slightly darker trim, add bedding in a complementary green pattern or subtle stripe, and choose natural accents like woven shades, oak furniture, or boucle pillows to keep it tactile. Monochrome doesn’t have to mean identical swatches—slight shifts in tone and an interplay of patterns, like gingham or small-scale florals, can create dimension and prevent the room from feeling one-note.
